snippet: More than seven in 10 residents surveyed want their new governor, who is an opponent of the Affordable Care Act, to keep the state’s Medicaid program as it is.
abstract: Kaiser Family Foundation poll finds over 7 in 10 Kentucky residents want Gov Matt Bevin to keep state's expanded Medicaid program in place; Bevin is opponent of Affordable Care Act and has called for reversing Medicaid expansion as unaffordable for state.
lead_paragraph: More than seven in 10 residents surveyed want their new governor, who is an opponent of the Affordable Care Act, to keep the state’s Medicaid program as it is.

headline.main: Poll Finds Kentuckians Split With Gov. Matt Bevin on Expanded Medicaid
headline.print_headline: Poll Finds Support for Kentucky Medicaid Expansion

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
